details.description:
Shoreditch, London

£45,000 per annum

Applications for this role have now closed

The Open Data Institute connects, equips and inspires people around the world to innovate with data.

Our learning activities help people to understand the possibilities of data in their work and in their lives. We deliver work both face to face and online, and work to try to reach as many people as possible in businesses, governments and the community. We have strong open principles, encouraging collaboration and sharing of tools and insights.

We are looking for a Senior Learning Consultant to help plan and deliver learning interventions with clients and oversee innovative programmes. This will involve working closely with clients from the public and private sector, and combining the products and insights we have and combining them with new ways of doing things.

Our Senior Learning Consultant must have:

  • experience communicating effectively with clients from businesses and governments at all levels of seniority
  • a track record in managing client relationships and growing them into successful programmes over time
  • the ability to support the ODI’s business development function as it builds a pipeline of learning work
  • understanding of how data can be used to improve how an organisation works
  • experience in the design and delivery of adult learning programmes, including the ability to lead outstanding workshops for clients
  • the ability to write clear, effective proposals and reports for clients to a high standard
  • the ability to speak confidently to represent the ODI at events

He or she needs to either have, or develop quickly:

  • confidence with the principles of instructional design and an ability to translate client specifications into learning materials
  • familiarity with the development and production of eLearning, preferably through the Adapt eLearning framework
  • the ability to manage input from multiple sources on a project in order to achieve client objectives
  • deep knowledge of the field of open data
  • an entrepreneurial mindset and a desire to develop new business and grow the suite of learning products.

Apply now

To apply, please send your CV and cover letter (max. two pages) to jobs@theodi.org by midnight on 20 February 2017.
